name: Better Proposals by Codex Solutions
title: Better Proposals by Codex Solutions
description: How to integrate Better Proposals with Make.com

children.text: Better Proposals is an online proposal software that streamlines creating, sending, tracking, and signing proposals, with automation and templates. Integrating with Make.com would automate workflows, enhance sales processes, and connect proposal actions to other business tools.
This is AI-generated content based on official Better Proposals documentation. The content may still contain errors—please verify important information. If you have questions, contact
How to get support on Better Proposals

Better Proposals is a community-developed application and is subjected to the developer's terms and conditions, which may include applicable fees. Make does not maintain or support this integration. For assistance, please https://f.make.com/r/reachout?app_name=Better%20Proposals&app_slug=better-proposals-community&app_unique_id=betterproposals-6a6khv.
To use the Better Proposals app in Make,
you must have an active Better Proposals account on a Premium or Enterprise plan and an API Key,
create your account on Better Proposals.
To install this app, you need Admin, Owner, or App Developer permissions.
the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.
To get started, you must first create a connection between Better Proposals and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
You can connect using the following method: API Key in Header.
You need to generate your API Key.
Log in to your Better Proposals account.
Navigate to the API key generator section.
Click the Generate API Key button.
The page will display your API Key or Token.
Optionally, you can regenerate your existing API Key or Token.
Some community developers require an additional specific
from the community developer's dashboard, generally found under
, add the Better Proposals module to your
If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your Better Proposals or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection. You must also enter any required third-party API keys obtained earlier.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the Better Proposals app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your
Creates a brand new document type, allowing you to define a custom structure for your documents.

Create a new proposal:  
This module allows you to generate and submit a brand-new proposal within your selected app, making it easy to kick off new projects or business opportunities directly from your automated workflow.

Generate a brand-new proposal cover to introduce your project or idea in a professional and visually appealing format. This module helps you quickly create a polished cover page tailored to your proposal’s needs.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific company using its unique ID.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific currency using its unique ID.
Retrieve a specific template using its unique ID. This module allows you to access detailed information about a particular template by providing its identifier.
Retrieves a complete list of all companies, allowing you to view and manage company records within your account.

The "List all currencies" module retrieves a comprehensive list of all available currencies from the connected service. This allows you to view and use up-to-date currency information in your scenarios.
Retrieve a complete list of all available document types, helping you see which types you can work with in your workflows.
Retrieves a list of all proposals, allowing you to view and manage every proposal currently available in your account.
Retrieves a complete list of all templates available in your account, making it easy for you to browse and select the ones you need for your projects.
Allows you to make a custom API request to the service, using your authorized connection. This lets you access features or endpoints that may not be available in the standard modules.
Triggers when a new proposal is created, allowing you to automatically start workflows or actions based on each new proposal that comes in.
Monitors and instantly notifies you whenever a new proposal is opened, so you can stay updated and take action right away.
Monitor and receive notifications whenever a proposal is marked as paid, allowing you to keep track of completed transactions efficiently.
Monitors your account for any new proposals you’ve sent, and triggers when a new proposal is sent out.
Monitor signed proposals for updates or changes, allowing you to stay informed whenever a proposal is signed or its status is modified.
You can look for more templates in
, where you'll find thousands of pre-created
You can have access to more resources related to this app on the following links :
Better Proposals topics on Make community

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
